description: A World Government stronghold known as the Judicial Island, where criminals are processed before being sent to Impel Down. The island exists in perpetual daylight and is one of three major government facilities connected by the Gates of Justice, alongside Marine Headquarters and Impel Down. The island features a massive waterfall leading to a void beneath it.

keyEvents.title: First View of Enies Lobby
keyEvents.description: The Straw Hat Pirates and their allies get their first glimpse of Enies Lobby as the Rocketman approaches the island.
keyEvents.significance: Marks the beginning of the Enies Lobby Arc and the start of the rescue mission to save Robin and Franky.

keyEvents.title: Paulie Explains Enies Lobby's Layout
keyEvents.description: Paulie provides detailed information about the island's structure, including the location of the Tower of Law and the Gates of Justice at the far back.
keyEvents.significance: Establishes the geography and strategic challenges the rescue party will face.

statusHistory.reason: Enies Lobby is operational as a World Government judicial facility

geographicFeatures.description: Enies Lobby exists in constant daylight with no nighttime, earning it the names 'Island of Never-Night' and 'Afternoon Island'
A massive waterfall beneath the island leads to a mysterious black void - a unique natural anomaly
Massive gates connecting Enies Lobby to Marine Headquarters and Impel Down via the Tarai Current

culturalSignificance: Enies Lobby serves as the judicial arm of the World Government, symbolizing the government's absolute authority and justice system. Its perpetual daylight represents the government's claim of constant vigilance and transparency, though this symbolism is ironic given the secretive nature of CP9's operations there.
